item.title: Setting Expectations for your Project
item.description: One of the hardest (both technically and emotionally) parts of academic life is knowing when something is “good enough” and how long it will actually take you to get there. For undergrads, this challenge is (slightly) reduced because coursework tends to have rubrics (to let you know what “good enough” looks like) and deadlines (the point at which, whether you like it or not, the thing is done). After undergrad, things get a little trickier.
